title: The Zombie Apocalypse
description: A survival story where every choice can save or doom you

1.dilemma: The zombie apocalypse has begun. You're at home when you hear your neighbors screaming for help from the apartment next door. You have limited resources and a safe shelter. You can help them risking attracting zombies or stay hidden guaranteeing your survival.
1.teaseOption1: What a noble gesture! I hope your new companions are worth your compromised safety. ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüßü
1.teaseOption2: Wise choice. Who needs humanity when you can survive alone? Their screams will fade soon. üôâüîí

2a.dilemma: You saved your neighbors: Maria (a nurse) and her 8-year-old son, Luke. After days together, you discover Maria is hiding a bite. She begs you to let her stay to take care of Luke until the end. But you know she'll transform, putting everyone in danger.
2a.firstAnswer: Let Maria stay with her son
2a.teaseOption1: Such a tender heart. Now Luke will watch his mother turn into a monster. A perfect memory to cherish. üë®‚Äçüë¶üíî
2a.teaseOption2: Brutal but pragmatic. An 8-year-old watching his mother being cast out to certain death... Will you sleep well tonight? üö™üò¢

2b.dilemma: After weeks alone, supplies are running low. From the window you see a looted supermarket but still with some shelves stocked. There's also a group of survivors that seems organized. You can join them or try to loot the store alone at night.
2b.teaseOption1: Finally some company! I hope these strangers are trustworthy and not psychopaths. ü§ùüò∞
2b.teaseOption2: The lone wolf strikes again. Why trust others when you can risk your life alone in the dark? üåôüè™

3a.dilemma: Maria transformed during the night. By miracle, you managed to neutralize her before she hurt anyone. Luke is in shock. Now you've found a survivor group that only accepts 'useful' adults. You can lie saying Luke has medical skills (taught by Maria) or tell the truth risking they'll reject him.
3a.secondAnswer: Tell the truth about the kid
3a.teaseOption1: What a compassionate liar! When they discover the deception, I hope they appreciate your good intentions. ü§•üíä
3a.teaseOption2: Honesty above all! Even if it means condemning an orphaned child. At least your conscience is clean. üìãüë¶

3b.dilemma: After kicking out Maria, Luke has withdrawn into himself. After days of walking, you find a military shelter offering protection in exchange for work. They want Luke for dangerous tasks (zombie bait). It's the only hope of survival for both of you.
3b.firstAnswer: Accept Luke doing the dangerous work
3b.teaseOption1: A traumatized child used as bait. But hey, at least you have a roof! Sure Maria would approve. üë¶üé£
3b.teaseOption2: You'd rather die with dignity than live in compromise. Romantic, but Luke will die with you. üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüíÄ

3c.dilemma: The group welcomed you. The leader, Marco, seems honest but rigid. During a reconnaissance mission you discover he's hiding a secret food stash from the rest of the group. If you expose him, you might cause a rebellion. If you stay silent, you're complicit in his betrayal.
3c.firstAnswer: Expose Marco in front of everyone
3c.teaseOption1: Public justice! I hope the civil war that follows is worth your moral integrity. ‚öñÔ∏èüî•
3c.teaseOption2: The diplomatic approach. Or are you just afraid of direct confrontation? ü§´üó£Ô∏è

3d.dilemma: The night looting went wrong. You're injured and a horde of zombies is chasing you. You manage to take refuge in a house where you find a terrified family: father, mother and two children. The door won't hold long. There's an exit in the back, but only one person can pass at a time.
3d.teaseOption1: What a chivalrous gesture! Sure you'll make it in time to escape after them? Zombies are patient. ‚è≥üßü‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
3d.teaseOption2: Survival instinct first. Their terrified faces will haunt you... if you survive. üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüò±

4a.dilemma: Your lie works, but the group urgently needs medical care after an attack. Luke must 'operate' on a seriously injured person. You can confess now saving the patient but losing trust, or let Luke try, risking the injured person's life.
4a.firstAnswer: Confess the lie and operate yourself
4a.teaseOption1: Finally honesty! Too bad it came when someone is bleeding out. ‚õëÔ∏èü©∏
4a.teaseOption2: An 8-year-old doing surgery. What could possibly go wrong? üî™üò∞

4b.dilemma: The group rejected Luke. Now you're alone again. After days of travel, you find an abandoned military bunker with supplies for months, but also a dying survivor who begs you to kill him to stop his transformation. Luke is watching. You can teach him that sometimes mercy requires violence, or protect him from this truth.
4b.firstAnswer: Execute the request in front of Luke
4b.secondAnswer: Send Luke away and kill privately
4b.teaseOption1: Life lesson number 47: how to mercy kill. Luke's childhood is truly over. üî´üë¶
4b.teaseOption2: Protect his innocence while killing in the shadows. A bit hypocritical, but understandable. üôàüó°Ô∏è

4c.dilemma: Luke has done the dangerous work for weeks, but he's changed. He's become cold, distant. One day you return from a mission and discover he killed another child who was stealing food. The shelter asks for your testimony: was it self-defense or murder?
4c.secondAnswer: Tell the truth: it was murder
4c.teaseOption1: Protect the little murderer. After all, you made him this way. How proud are you? üõ°Ô∏èüî™
4c.teaseOption2: The truth condemns Luke to execution. But hey, at least you're morally consistent. ‚öñÔ∏èüíÄ

4d.dilemma: You've been wandering for months. Luke is sick, high fever. You find a group that has antibiotics but wants you to lead a suicidal raid against a zombie horde in exchange. Probability of death: 90%. It's Luke's only hope.
4d.firstAnswer: Accept the suicidal raid to save Luke
4d.teaseOption1: What a noble sacrifice! Luke will survive only to die alone when you fall. üíä‚öîÔ∏è
4d.teaseOption2: There's always another way... or maybe not. Time is running out and Luke is getting worse. Good luck. ‚è∞üò∑

4e.dilemma: The public revelation sparked chaos. The group split. Marco was lynched. Now you're the new leader by default. An injured member asks to be treated, but medicines are almost gone. Another member is pregnant and will need those medicines in days.
4e.secondAnswer: Save medicines for the pregnant woman
4e.teaseOption1: Certain life now vs potential life tomorrow. The injured survives, the newborn probably won't. üíäü§ï
4e.teaseOption2: You condemn an injured person to death to save an unborn child. Pragmatic or cruel? ü§∞‚ö∞Ô∏è

4f.dilemma: The private confrontation with Marco reveals the truth: he's setting aside food for a cure experiment. He has a secret laboratory. He claims he's close to a zombie-virus vaccine. You can help him in secret or expose him anyway.
4f.teaseOption1: Accomplice to a possible genius or a manipulative liar? Only time will tell. üî¨ü§´
4f.teaseOption2: Destroy the possibility of a cure on principle. What if he was right? üíâ‚ùå

4g.dilemma: You let the family go first. As you pass last, the father turns and pushes you out, closing the door behind him. Now you're trapped with zombies coming. By miracle you find an escape route but can only save one of them by opening the door. Who do you choose?
4g.teaseOption1: You forgive the traitorous father and save his family. Saint or idiot? üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶‚ú®
4g.teaseOption2: Sweet revenge. All of them will die because the father betrayed you. Fair? üòàüî•

4h.dilemma: You escaped first. The family died. Guilt haunts you. Months later, you find a safe shelter that requires a 'confession' of any past crimes to enter. Lying means safety but living in deception. Telling the truth means possible rejection.
4h.teaseOption1: Honest to the end. Admire your integrity as they close the door in your face? üö™üòî
4h.teaseOption2: A buried secret is a forgotten secret. Until it haunts you in nightmares. ü§•üò±

5a.dilemma: You confessed and operated on the injured, saving them. The group forgave you for the lie about Luke. Months later, you have the opportunity to evacuate to a safe zone. There's space for 5 people. The group is 8. You choose who to leave. Luke is obviously one of the 5, but the other 3?
5a.secondAnswer: Choose based on vulnerability (sick, elderly, children)
5a.teaseOption1: Survival of the fittest. Darwin would be proud. The weak stay to die. üí™‚ö∞Ô∏è
5a.teaseOption2: You save the weakest condemning the strongest. Noble but absurd. Who will protect the weak? ü§ïüë¥

5b.dilemma: Luke tried to operate. The patient died in agony. The group discovered the truth and wants you dead. You manage to escape but Luke is traumatized. Years later, Luke has become a ruthless leader of a raider group. He asks you to join him in acts of violence against innocents. He says you taught him that survival is worth more than morality.
5b.teaseOption1: Accomplice to the monster you created. At least the family is united in evil. üë®‚Äçüë¶üòà
5b.teaseOption2: You abandon him when he needs guidance most. The circle closes. üîÑüíî

5c.dilemma: Years have passed. Luke grew up in the bunker. He's seen too much. One day he announces he wants to go out to find other survivors. The outside world is still dangerous. You can let him go respecting his autonomy or prevent him from leaving to protect him, potentially forever.
5c.teaseOption1: You free him to an uncertain future. Parental pride or irresponsibility? üó∫Ô∏èüö™
5c.teaseOption2: A golden cage is still a cage. Are you protecting or imprisoning him? üîíüè†

5d.dilemma: You protected Luke from violence, but he heard everything. Now you face a final choice: an evacuation helicopter has space for only one. The pilot says they'll take a child or an able adult. Luke is looking at you. What do you do?
5d.teaseOption1: You save yourself leaving a child alone in the apocalypse. Survival first. üöÅüò¢
5d.teaseOption2: Final sacrifice. Luke will live, you'll die here. At least you'll die in peace... maybe. üë¶‚úàÔ∏è

5e.dilemma: You gave false testimony. Luke is free but has become a serial killer in the shelter. He kills anyone who 'offends' him. Now he's targeted you, saying you're the only person who can testify against him. You must flee or face him in a final confrontation that only one of you will survive.
5e.teaseOption1: You run from the monster you created and protected. Cowardice or wisdom? üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüí®
5e.teaseOption2: One of you will die. At least you'll finish what you started. ‚öîÔ∏èüíÄ

5f.dilemma: Luke was executed for murder. You're alone. Years later, the shelter is attacked. You can sound the alarm saving everyone but revealing your position to the attackers, or escape silently letting everyone die.
5f.teaseOption1: Redemption through sacrifice. Luke would be... well, dead, so probably nothing. üîî‚öîÔ∏è
5f.teaseOption2: Once again you choose yourself. At least you're consistent in your cowardice. ü§êüèÉ

5g.dilemma: Miraculously you survived the raid. Luke recovered thanks to the antibiotics. Ten years later, the world is slowly healing. Luke has become a doctor. He offers you a choice: you can join him in building a new hospital or search for the remains of your pre-apocalypse family.
5g.teaseOption1: You abandon the past for an uncertain future. Pragmatic or cowardly? üè•üåÖ
5g.teaseOption2: You chase ghosts of the past leaving a certainty. Heart against reason. üîçüë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß

5h.dilemma: You didn't find another solution. Luke died of fever in your arms. Years later, you're alone and elderly. An orphaned child finds you and asks for help, just like Luke used to. You still have supplies for a few days. Sharing them means dying sooner.
5h.firstAnswer: Help the child and accept death
5h.teaseOption1: The circle closes. You die as you wished to live. Peace finally. ‚òÆÔ∏èüí´
5h.teaseOption2: You lost a son and refuse to save another. Eternal solitude. üë§üö´

5i.dilemma: The injured recovered, the pregnant woman died of complications. You're responsible. The group hates you. Months later you discover the injured person you saved is planning to kill you for revenge (he was the dead woman's husband). Do you confront him?
5i.firstAnswer: Confront the man and ask forgiveness
5i.teaseOption1: You seek redemption from the widower you created. Courage or stupidity? üôè‚ö∞Ô∏è
5i.teaseOption2: You kill the man you saved. The irony is delicious. üîÑüî™

5j.dilemma: The pregnant woman gave birth successfully. The injured died cursing you. The newborn grows healthy. At 5 years old, the child becomes seriously ill. A bone marrow transplant is needed. You're compatible. The operation has a 50% chance of killing you. Do you do it?
5j.teaseOption1: You risk everything to save the life you chose to protect. Fatal consistency. üíâ‚ö∞Ô∏è
5j.teaseOption2: You saved them before birth only to let them die now? Interesting logic. üë∂üíî

5k.dilemma: You secretly helped Marco for months. The vaccine is almost ready. But it requires a final test on a live human subject. There's a 30% chance of death. Marco asks you to volunteer yourself or find someone else who's unaware. What do you choose?
5k.teaseOption1: You offer yourself as a human guinea pig. Heroism or guilt? üíâüß™
5k.teaseOption2: You sacrifice an innocent for science. Mengele would be proud. üî¨üòà

5l.dilemma: You exposed Marco. There was no laboratory, it was all a deception. Marco is executed. Months later, you find his notes proving he was actually working on a cure and you were one step from success. Now you must reveal the truth or hide it forever.
5l.firstAnswer: Reveal the truth about your mistake
5l.teaseOption1: You admit killing the only hope for a cure. Brutal honesty. üìãüò±
5l.teaseOption2: You bury the truth and the possibility of salvation. Perfect coward. üî•üìö

5m.dilemma: You saved the mother and children. The father died. Years later, one of the children (now a teenager) confesses knowing you killed zombies that were once people dear to him. He asks if you would kill him if he transformed. How do you answer?
5m.secondAnswer: Promise you could never do it
5m.teaseOption1: You promise to kill who you saved. Honesty that hurts. üî´üíî
5m.teaseOption2: You lie for comfort. When he transforms, this lie will haunt you. ü§•üßü

5n.dilemma: You let them all die. You've been alone for years. The guilt is unbearable. One day you find another survivor who offers you cyanide, saying some people don't deserve to survive. Do you accept their 'offer' or continue living with remorse?
5n.teaseOption1: Suicide as the ultimate escape. Peace or definitive cowardice? ‚ò†Ô∏è‚ö∞Ô∏è
5n.teaseOption2: You choose to bear the weight of remorse forever. Eternal torture. üòîüîó

5o.dilemma: You confessed. The shelter rejected you for your past cowardice. Wandering alone, you find the zombified remains of the family you abandoned. One of them still carries a happy family photo. You can 'free' them by killing them or leave them in that state eternally.
5o.firstAnswer: Kill the zombies to free them
5o.secondAnswer: Leave them in their eternal state
5o.teaseOption1: Final mercy for those you condemned. Late redemption. üî´üëª
5o.teaseOption2: You let your cowardice have eternal consequences. Poetic. üßü‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüì∏

5p.dilemma: You lied and were accepted. You've lived in the shelter for years. One day a new member arrives: it's the mother of the family you abandoned, survived but traumatized. She doesn't recognize you yet. Do you confess or keep lying?
5p.firstAnswer: Confess the truth to the mother
5p.teaseOption1: Finally the courage to face your past. Prepare for the consequences. üò¢üó£Ô∏è
5p.teaseOption2: You live next to your victim in a lie. What a daily nightmare. üé≠üò∞
